titleproper.value: Guide to the James Neugass Photograph Collection <num>ALBA.PHOTO.012</num>

publisher.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

addressline: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2017-09-07T14:13:11</date>

corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

abstract.value: James Neugass (1905-1949) was a writer who served as an ambulance driver during the Spanish Civil War. The images in this collection were accrued by Neuglass in the course of his work in Spain. The collection contains prints of soldiers at the front, relaxing behind the lines, and engaging in their daily activities. The collection also contains images of Spanish civilians, damaged/shelled buildings, injured soldiers and casualties.

p.value: Materials are open to researchers. Please contact the Tamiment Library & Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives for more information and to schedule an appointment, tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu or 212-998-2630.

Published citations should take the following form: <lb/><lb/>Identification of item, date; Collection name; Collection number; box number; folder number; <lb/>Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives <lb/>Elmer Holmes Bobst Library <lb/>70 Washington Square South <lb/>New York, NY 10012, New York University Libraries.
<list><item>Nelson, Cary. The Wound and the Dream (University of Illinois Press, 2002)</item></list>

<emph render="bold">Series I: Prints</emph>. The 41 black and white prints are arranged alphabetically by topic. All were taken in Spain during the Civil War. The collection contains prints of nurses, soldiers at the Jarama front, relaxing behind the lines at Teruel, and engaging in their daily activities. The collection also contains images of Spanish civilians, damaged/shelled buildings in Barcelona and Lerida, medical tents, injured soldiers and casualties of war. Two of the prints are credited to Prensa Extranjera Censurado.

corpname.value: Spain. Ejercito Popular de la Republica. Abraham Lincoln Battalion
